data.title: Event roundup: 15+ things to do this July in Houston
data.meta_description: Here are some exciting events to attend in Houston for the rest of July.
data.text:
Hello Houston! Iâ€™m Holly Galvan Posey, and July is filled with exciting events and activities to make your summer sizzle. Heads up! Be sure to double-check that events are still happening, as Hurricane Beryl has disrupted and changed plans for some events this month.

ğŸ½ï¸ July 5-19: Latin Restaurant Weeks

From July 5 through July 19, explore the diversity of Latin American cuisine at Latin Restaurant Weeks (LRW). Returning for its sixth year in Houston, LRW offers a unique culinary adventure with special menu items, limited-time deals, and pre-fixe menus from over 10 Latin American countries. Participating restaurants, cafes, coffee shops, food trucks, and bakers will showcase the rich flavors and traditions of Latin cuisine.

ğŸ“ Various locations in Houston

ğŸ•’ Recurring daily

ğŸ’µ Price: Varies by location

ğŸ­ July 16-August 4: Fiddler on the Roof

Experience the beloved musical Fiddler on the Roof at A.D. Players at the George Theater. Follow Tevye, a poor Jewish milkman, as he navigates tradition, family, and change in the small village of Anatevka in Imperial Russia.

ğŸ“ 5420 Westheimer Rd., Houston

ğŸ•’ Recurring daily

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for ticket details

ğŸ¦ July 16-August 4: Disneyâ€™s The Lion King

Experience the phenomenon of Disneyâ€™s The Lion King at the Hobby Center. Winner of six Tony AwardsÂ®, including Best Musical, this landmark musical features stunning visuals and unforgettable music by Elton John and Tim Rice.

ğŸ“ 800 Bagby Street, Houston, TX 77002

ğŸ•’ Recurring daily

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for ticket details

ğŸ¬ July 18: Movie Night at Helix Park - The Parent Trap

Enjoy a showtime summer at Helix Park with a screening of â€œThe Parent Trap.â€ Relax with freshly popped popcorn, candies, and drinks while watching the movie at the amphitheater-style lawn.

ğŸ“ 1885 Old Spanish Trail, Houston

ğŸ•’ 6:00 p.m.-8:00 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Free

ğŸ• July 19-21: Houston World Series of Dog Shows

Enjoy lively performance events, exhibitions, relay races, conformation judging, seminars, displays, and shopping at the Houston World Series of Dog Shows. Everything for dog lovers at NRG Stadium!

ğŸ“ One NRG Park, Houston

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for ticket details

ğŸ¦‹ July 20: Butterfly Walks

Join Buffalo Bayou Partnership for a Butterfly Walk led by Nancy Greig, exploring local butterfly species, their life cycle, and habitat. Meet at Jackson Hill Bridge on Allen Parkway.

ğŸ“ 3422 Allen Parkway, Houston

ğŸ•’ 9-10:30 a.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Free, reservations recommended

ğŸ¹ July 20: Scales and Cocktails at the Arboretum

Mix and mingle with reptile ambassadors at the Houston Arboretum & Nature Center. Enjoy a cocktail while learning about snakes, lizards, and turtles, followed by a hike on nighttime trails.

ğŸ“ 4501 Woodway Drive, Houston

ğŸ•’ 7-9 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: $35 members, $50 nonmembers

ğŸ¥ July 20: Summer Movie - The Lion King

Celebrate the 30th anniversary of The Lion King at 1500 McKinney Street. Bring blankets, camping chairs, and snacks for this outdoor movie night with games and activities. Costumes are strongly encouraged!

ğŸ“ 1500 McKinney Street, Houston

ğŸ•’ 7-10 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Free

ğŸ¶ July 21: Houston Grand Opera at the Childrenâ€™s Museum

Enjoy a mesmerizing performance by the Houston Grand Opera at the Childrenâ€™s Museum of Houston, featuring Jorge Arguetaâ€™s enchanting verses â€œAgua, AgÃ¼ita (Water, Little Water)â€ and â€œFuego, Fueguito (Fire, Little Fire).â€

ğŸ“ 1500 Binz Street, Houston

ğŸ•’ 2-2:30 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for details

ğŸ§˜ June 27: Indoor Yoga at TMC Helix Park

Join a 45-minute yoga session led by Casey from TruFusion, incorporating movement, breathwork, and deep rest. Suitable for all fitness levels, the class is held on the last Thursday of each month.

ğŸ“ 1885 Old Spanish Trail, Houston

ğŸ•’ 5-5:45 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Free

ğŸ¦– July 26-28: Jurassic Quest

Make pter-iffic memories at Jurassic Quest, the worldâ€™s largest and most popular Dino event. Play with adorable baby dinos, excavate fossils, and train raptors while surrounded by life-size behemoths like Spinosaurus and Tyrannosaurus rex.

ğŸ“ One NRG Park, Houston

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for ticket details

ğŸ¦‡ July 26: Batman in Concert

Celebrate the 35th anniversary of the film â€œBatmanâ€ at Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion with the Houston Symphony. Enjoy the movie on a giant screen while Danny Elfmanâ€™s iconic score is performed live.

ğŸ“ 2005 Lake Robbins Drive, The Woodlands

ğŸ•’ 8:00 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Check website for ticket details

ğŸ” July 27: The Dinner Detective Interactive Murder Mystery Show

Dive into a world of mystery with Houstonâ€™s Dinner Detective Show! Solve crimes while enjoying gourmet meals in an interactive theater setting.

ğŸ“ 2712 Southwest Freeway, Houston

ğŸ•’ 6.-8:30 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: $76.95

ğŸ July 28: La Centerra Farmers Market

Visit La Centerra Farmers Market for fresh, locally sourced produce, organic fruits, vegetables, local honey, meats, and more from local farmers and artisans. Support your well-being with delicious, chemical-free products and connect with your community.

ğŸ“ 23501 Cinco Ranch Blvd., Katy

ğŸ•’ 11 a.m.-3 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: Free

ğŸ¦… July 28: HMNS at Levy Park

The Houston Museum of Natural Science brings real specimens and artifacts to Levy Park. Join museum experts for an educational experience focused on birds.

ğŸ“ 3120 Southwest Fwy., Suite 102, Houston

ğŸ’µ Price: Free

â›³ July 28-29: Vernon Dean Foundation Celebrity Golf Tournament

Join the 2nd Annual Celebrity Golf Tournament at Quail Valley Golf Club to support the Salvation Army and the Boys and Girls Club of Houston. Hosted by former NFL player Vernon Dean, the event features celebrities like Darrell Green, Eric Dickerson, Mark Clayton, and Mark Henry.

ğŸ“ Quail Valley Golf Club, 2880 La Quinta Drive, Missouri City

ğŸ•’ 8:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m.

ğŸ’µ Price: $150 per player, $500 for a foursome
